basics.name: Dmitry Verhoturov
basics.label: Site Reliability Engineer
basics.summary:
• 8+ years of system engineering expertise and work with Linux servers.
  • 3 years of management.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Solid UNIX and TCP/IP network fundamentals knowledge.
  • Huge expertise in monitoring.
  • Advanced troubleshooting and analytical skills.
  • Well-developed understanding of internet technologies and client/server architecture.

work.summary: IPonWeb (300+ employees) provides technology to advertising industry, Real Time Bidding auctions in particular — company handles millions of transactions every minute, terabytes of data stored and processed every day. I created and managed a team of engineers, ensuring company services operations 24/7/365.
highlights: Developed applications/modules in Python, Puppet (+Ruby) and SQL.
Deployed and maintained applications on Amazon and Google cloud services.
Part of my work is to implement changes, and I know well how to make other people do what I need. I interact with literally every team in the company in progress of introducing improvements.
Created and integrated on-duty incident management procedures (how, when and what to do when you're on-call), by which duty shifts are operating since then.
Created a new team of eight people in three cities from scratch.
Wrote of a ton of documentation and recorder couple of videos for internal education.
Halfway through team transformation to SRE.

work.summary: Svyaznoy Zagruzka (~40 employees) is a telecommunication content provider, it powers services which send and receive SMS messages and USSD requests, and gives that ability to hundreds of partners. I handled client integration and support. My day-to-day activity was monitoring and troubleshooting (network and application levels, Wireshark and SQL console were my best friends).
highlights: Maintained and monitored the company’s software, self-written parts is Java, served by Glassfish and Tomcat — I've tuned these systems and debugged Java software.
Created Python+Flask web application for recurring task of extracting network dump slices cut by time and client.
Rewrote dozen of scripts to Python from Perl and Bash, and created a bunch of new ones.
Maintained and tuned the IT infrastructure of the company. Every day I was working with Linux (CentOS, Debian), SQL (MySQL, MSSQL) and virtualization (VMware).

I was the one detecting if problem is on our or client's side, and the one finding ways to fix problems on client's side no matter if they are tech-savvy or not. Also it was my responsibility to interact with other company technical departments, troubleshooting and fixing problems with external services providers.

work.summary: Served army for one year after obtaining my degree.
70 employees company, BioChemMack resells medical equipment. Initially, I was working on medical devices technical support. Then I shifted into internal services support.
highlights: Created and populated a wiki with information about internal infrastructure.

Working as support facing clients, I have read tens of books of documentation and was being able to fix all different kinds of problems with software and hardware (for example used for the analysis of DNA).
Migrated server from the old CentOS to Ubuntu, reviewed and rewrote configuration of all used Linux services and networking.
Developed autonomous work of local network parts in case of events, such as a breakage of the main channel of communication or interrupted local connectivity.

work.summary: FS Group is a distributed reseller company with 10 employees in 3 different locations, my job was local system engineer. I was one-man army providing every IT service company needed.
highlights: Established a network setup that is still in use in three original offices without changes.
Created a documentation on company infrastructure for future engineers use.
As a side job took a part in site development, SEO and advertising.

skills.name: System administration
keywords: Debian and Red Hat distributions family
